item.title: DS3 Over Copper Avoids Fiber Installation
item.description:
Businesses desire fiber optic connections for their high bandwidth capabilities, but the installation costs can be prohibitive, ranging from tens of thousands to even hundreds of thousands of dollars. However, there’s an alternative solution worth considering: DS3 over Copper. Although DS3 is often associated with fiber optic lines, it’s essentially a 45 Mbps TDM protocol that can operate on various carriers. Originally, DS3 was delivered using T3 coaxial copper lines, waveguides, or microwave transmissions...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/ds3-over-copper-avoids-fiber-installation/
